title: Natural pigment from Paracoccus carotinifaciens (Panaferd®‐AX) enhanced colour and immune system of Pacific white shrimp (Litopenaeus vannamei)
content:
Abstract

This study investigated effects of a natural carotenoid, Panaferd®-AX, derived from the carotenoid-rich microorganism, Paracoccus carotinifaciens, on growth performance, survival, body pigmentation, immune responses and disease resistance of juvenile Pacific white shrimp (Litopenaeus vannamei). Four dietary levels of Panaferd®-AX (0, 250, 500 and 1250 mg kg−1 diet) were supplemented to a basal diet. The shrimp with an initial body weight of 4.00 ± 0.01 g were fed with these diets for 30 days. The results showed that shrimp growth, feed utilization and survival were not affected (p > 0.05) by the inclusion of the Panaferd®-AX in any of the dosages tested in the basal diet, under the current experimental conditions. Pigmentation and hemolymph immunological responses were significantly affected by the diets containing Panaferd®-AX (p < 0.05). The dietary supplementation with Panaferd®-AX enhances disease resistance against Vibrio parahaemolyticus and mortality delayed after exposure to white spot syndrome virus (WSSV). In conclusion, the diet supplemented with Panaferd®-AX can enhance pigmentation and antioxidant competence of L. vannamei and it has potential as a promising carotenoid source.
author:
Nutt Nuntapong, 
Wutiporn Phromkunthong, 
Naraid Suanyuk, 
Dominique Corlay
